The honor goes to Aryabhata, which was launched on April 19, 1975, by the Soviet Union using a Kosmos-3M launch vehicle. However, RTP is significant as it was an experimental spin stabilized satellite launched by Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on August 10, 1979, from Satish Dhawan Space Centre (SDSC) Or Sriharikota Range (SHAR), Sriharikota. Unfortunately, the mission failed to reach its intended orbit due to a control valve malfunction in the second stage.

edited_claim: Feluda: The Golden Trail is a crime novel written by Indian author Satyajit Ray, featuring the fictional Kolkata-based detective Pradosh Chandra Mitra, also known as Feluda. The character first appeared in a Bengali children's magazine called Sandesh in 1965 and has since become one of the most impactful Bengali characters of all time. Feluda resides at 21 Rajani Sen Road, Ballygunge, Calcutta, West Bengal. Satyajit Ray wrote thirty-five Feluda stories, including The Golden Fortress (1974) and The Elephant God (1978), two of which were adapted into films. The novel Feluda: The Golden Trail was first published in West Bengal in 1974 by Ananda Publishers and has also been adapted into a film.
